Element: Alpivab 200 mg concentrate for solution for infusion
Text: Alpivab 200 mg concentrate for solution for infusion
peramivir

Element: This medicine is subject to additional monitoring. This will allow quick identification of new safety information. You can help by reporting any side effects you may get. See the end of section 4 for how to report side effects.
Text: This medicine is subject to additional monitoring. This will allow quick identification of new safety information. You can help by reporting any side effects you may get. See the end of section 4 for how to report side effects.

Element: Read all of this leaflet carefully before you start using this medicine because it contains important information for you.
Text: Read all of this leaflet carefully before you start using this medicine because it contains important information for you.

Element: ·Keep this leaflet. You may need to read it again.
Text: ·Keep this leaflet. You may need to read it again.

Element: ·If you have any further questions, ask your doctor or pharmacist.
Text: ·If you have any further questions, ask your doctor or pharmacist.

Element: ·If you get any side effects, talk to your doctor or pharmacist.This includes any possible side effects not listed in this leaflet. See section 4.
Text: ·If you get any side effects, talk to your doctor or pharmacist.This includes any possible side effects not listed in this leaflet. See section 4.

Element: 1. What Alpivab is and what it is used for
Text: 1.       What Alpivab is and what it is used for

Element: Alpivab contains the active substance peramivir which belongs to a group of medicines called neuraminidase inhibitors. These medicines prevent the influenza virus from spreading inside the body.
Text: Alpivab contains the active substance peramivir which belongs to a group of medicines called neuraminidase inhibitors. These medicines prevent the influenza virus from spreading inside the body.

Element: Alpivab is used to treat adults and children aged from 2 years with influenza that is not severe enough to require hospitalisation.
Text: Alpivab is used to treat adults and children aged from 2 years with influenza that is not severe enough to require hospitalisation.

Element: 2. What you need to know before you are given Alpivab
Text: 2.       What you need to know before you are given Alpivab

Element: You must not receive Alpivab
Text: You must not receive Alpivab

Element: ·if you are allergic to peramivir or any of the other ingredients of this medicine (listed in section 6)
Text: ·if you are allergic to peramivir or any of the other ingredients of this medicine (listed in section 6)
Warnings and precautions

Element: Talk to your doctor or pharmacist before you are given Alpivab if you have reduced kidney function. Your doctor may have to adjust your dose.
Text: Talk to your doctor or pharmacist before you are given Alpivab if you have reduced kidney function. Your doctor may have to adjust your dose.

Element: Tell your doctor immediately if you experience serious skin or allergic reactions after Alpivab is given. Symptoms may include skin or throat swelling, difficulty breathing, blistering rash or peeling skin. See section 4.
Text: Tell your doctor immediately if you experience serious skin or allergic reactions after Alpivab is given. Symptoms may include skin or throat swelling, difficulty breathing, blistering rash or peeling skin. See section 4.

Element: Tell your doctor immediately if you experience abnormal behaviour after Alpivab is given. Symptoms may include confusion, difficulty thinking or hallucinations. See section 4.
Text: Tell your doctor immediately if you experience abnormal behaviour after Alpivab is given. Symptoms may include confusion, difficulty thinking or hallucinations. See section 4.
Children and adolescents

Element: Alpivab is not recommended in children aged under 2 years.
Text: Alpivab is not recommended in children aged under 2 years.
Other medicines and Alpivab

Element: Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are using, have recently used or might use any other medicines.
Text: Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are using, have recently used or might use any other medicines.

Element: Live attenuated influenza vaccines should not be given until 48 hours after treatment with Alpivab. This is because Alpivab may prevent these vaccines from working well enough.
Text: Live attenuated influenza vaccines should not be given until 48 hours after treatment with Alpivab. This is because Alpivab may prevent these vaccines from working well enough.
Pregnancy and breast-feeding

Element: Tell your doctor if you are pregnant or breast-feeding. Your doctor will advise on whether you can be given Alpivab during pregnancy, or whether you are to stop breast-feeding for a short period after getting Alpivab.
Text: Tell your doctor if you are pregnant or breast-feeding. Your doctor will advise on whether you can be given Alpivab during pregnancy, or whether you are to stop breast-feeding for a short period after getting Alpivab.
Driving and using machines

Element: Alpivab is not likely to change your ability to drive and use machines.
Text: Alpivab is not likely to change your ability to drive and use machines.
Alpivab contains sodium

Element: This medicine contains 212.4 mg sodium (main component of cooking/table salt) in each dose consisting of 3 vials. This is equivalent to 10.6 % of the recommended maximum daily dietary intake of sodium for an adult.
Text: This medicine contains 212.4 mg sodium (main component of cooking/table salt) in each dose consisting of 3 vials. This is equivalent to 10.6 % of the recommended maximum daily dietary intake of sodium for an adult.

Element: 3. How Alpivab is given
Text: 3.       How Alpivab is given

Element: Alpivab is given by a healthcare profesional as a single dose within 2 days of the start of influenza symptoms. It is first diluted and then given into a vein by infusion (drip), over 15 to 30 minutes.
Text: Alpivab is given by a healthcare profesional as a single dose within 2 days of the start of influenza symptoms. It is first diluted and then given into a vein  by infusion (drip), over 15 to 30 minutes.

Element: ·Adults and adolescents (13 years and older) receive 600 mg (3 Alpivab vials).
Text: ·Adults and adolescents (13 years and older) receive 600 mg (3 Alpivab vials).

Element: ·Children aged from 2 years weighing 50 kg or more receive 600 mg (3 Alpivab vials).
Text: ·Children aged from 2 years weighing 50 kg or more receive 600 mg (3 Alpivab vials).

Element: ·Children aged from 2 years weighing less than 50 kg receive 12 mg per kg body weight.
Text: ·Children aged from 2 years weighing less than 50 kg receive 12 mg per kg body weight.

Element: ·Patients with reduced kidney function may require a reduced dose.
Text: ·Patients with reduced kidney function may require a reduced dose.

Element: If you have any further questions on the use of this medicine, ask your doctor or pharmacist.
Text: If you have any further questions on the use of this medicine, ask your doctor or pharmacist.

Element: 4. Possible side effects
Text: 4.       Possible side effects

Element: Like all medicines, this medicine can cause side effects, although not everybody gets them.
Text: Like all medicines, this medicine can cause side effects, although not everybody gets them.

Element: Contact your doctor immediately if any of the following side effects occur:
Text: Contact your doctor immediately if any of the following side effects occur:

Element: Rare, may affect up to 1 in 1,000 people
Text: Rare, may affect up to 1 in 1,000 people

Element: ·severe skin rash with or without blisters and fever
Text: ·severe skin rash with or without blisters and fever

Element: Not known, frequency cannot be estimated from the available data
Text: Not known, frequency cannot be estimated from the available data

Element: ·very severe skin reactions, including Steven-Johnson syndrome and dermatitis exfoliative
Text: ·very severe skin reactions, including Steven-Johnson syndrome and dermatitis exfoliative

Element: These skin reactions are life-threatening rashes with fever and blisters and can effect the lining of the mouth and genitals.
Text: These skin reactions are life-threatening rashes with fever and blisters and can effect the lining of the mouth and genitals.

Element: ·severe allergic reactions, including severe allergic shock reaction with features such as itchy rash, swelling of the throat and tongue, breathing difficulty, lightheadedness and vomiting
Text: ·severe allergic reactions, including severe allergic shock reaction with features such as itchy rash, swelling of the throat and tongue, breathing difficulty, lightheadedness and vomiting

Element: Other side effects occur with the following frequencies:
Text: Other side effects occur with the following frequencies:

Element: Common, may affect up to 1 in 10 people
Text: Common, may affect up to 1 in 10 people

Element: ·low levels of a white blood cell type called neutrophils
Text: ·low levels of a white blood cell type called neutrophils

Element: ·blood tests showing increased levels of lactate dehydrogenase
Text: ·blood tests showing increased levels of lactate dehydrogenase

Element: ·nausea (feeling sick), vomiting
Text: ·nausea (feeling sick), vomiting

Element: Uncommon, may affect up to 1 in 100 people
Text: Uncommon, may affect up to 1 in 100 people

Element: ·decreased appetite
Text: ·decreased appetite

Element: ·blood tests showing decreased levels of albumin, glucose, lactate dehydrogenase
Text: ·blood tests showing decreased levels of albumin, glucose, lactate dehydrogenase

Element: ·blood tests showing increased levels of chloride, potassium, sodium, uric acid, protein total, gamma-glutamyltransferase, creatine phosphokinase, urea, creatinine
Text: ·blood tests showing increased levels of chloride, potassium, sodium, uric acid, protein total, gamma-glutamyltransferase, creatine phosphokinase, urea, creatinine
·sleeplessness

Element: ·reduced sense of touch or sensation
Text: ·reduced sense of touch or sensation

Element: ·abnormal sensation such as prickling, tingling and itchiness
Text: ·abnormal sensation such as prickling, tingling and itchiness

Element: ·blurred vision
Text: ·blurred vision

Element: ·prolonged time of the heart ventricle activity, measured in the ECG
Text: ·prolonged time of the heart ventricle activity, measured in the ECG

Element: ·upper abdominal pain, abdominal discomfort
Text: ·upper abdominal pain, abdominal discomfort

Element: ·inflammation of stomach lining
Text: ·inflammation of stomach lining

Element: ·skin inflammation, eczema, rash, nettle-rash
Text: ·skin inflammation, eczema, rash, nettle-rash

Element: ·joint pain
Text: ·joint pain

Element: ·urobilin presented in the urine
Text: ·urobilin presented in the urine

Element: ·increased level of urine ketone body
Text: ·increased level of urine ketone body

Element: ·chest discomfort, fatigue
Text: ·chest discomfort, fatigue

Element: Not known, frequency cannot be estimated from the available data
Text: Not known, frequency cannot be estimated from the available data

Element: ·abnormal behaviour, delirium
Text: ·abnormal behaviour, delirium

Element: ·liver disorder
Text: ·liver disorder

Element: ·blood test showing increased levels of alanine aminotransferase, aspartate aminotransferase
Text: ·blood test showing increased levels of alanine aminotransferase, aspartate aminotransferase

Element: ·acute kidney injury, reduced kidney function
Text: ·acute kidney injury, reduced kidney function

Element: Children and Adolescents from 2 years
Text: Children and Adolescents from 2 years

Element: Side effects were similar to adults but also included the following:
Text: Side effects were similar to adults but also included the following:

Element: Common, may affect up to 1 in 10 people
Text: Common, may affect up to 1 in 10 people

Element: ·rash on the injection site
Text: ·rash on the injection site
·fever
·red ear drum
·restlessness
·itching
Reporting of side effects

Element: If you get any side effects, talk to your doctor or pharmacist.This includes any possible side effects not listed in this leaflet. You can also report side effects directly via the national reporting system listed in Appendix V. By reporting side effects you can help provide more information on the safety of this medicine.
Text: If you get any side effects, talk to your doctor or pharmacist.This includes any possible side effects not listed in this leaflet. You can also report side effects directly via the national reporting system listed in Appendix V. By reporting side effects you can help provide more information on the safety of this medicine.

Element: 5. How to store Alpivab
Text: 5.       How to store Alpivab

Element: Keep this medicine out of the sight and reach of children.
Text: Keep this medicine out of the sight and reach of children.

Element: Do not use this medicine after the expiry date which is stated on the label and carton after EXP. The expiry date refers to the last day of that month.
Text: Do not use this medicine after the expiry date which is stated on the label and carton after EXP. The expiry date refers to the last day of that month.

Element: Do not refrigerate or freeze.
Text: Do not refrigerate or freeze.

Element: Once diluted, administer the prepared Alpivab solution immediately; otherwise, store in a refrigerator (2 °C – 8 °C) for up to 24 hours.
Text: Once diluted, administer the prepared Alpivab solution immediately; otherwise, store in a refrigerator (2 °C – 8 °C) for up to 24 hours.

Element: 6. Contents of the pack and other information
Text: 6.       Contents of the pack and other information
What Alpivab contains

Element: ·The active substance is peramivir.
Text: ·The active substance is peramivir.

Element: Each 20 mL vial contains 200 mg peramivir. 1 mL concentrate for solution for infusion contains 10 mg peramivir (anhydrous base).
Text: Each 20 mL vial contains 200 mg peramivir. 1 mL concentrate for solution for infusion contains 10 mg peramivir (anhydrous base).

Element: ·The other ingredients are sodium chloride, water for injections, hydrochloric acid (for pH adjustment), sodium hydroxide (for pH adjustment).
Text: ·The other ingredients are sodium chloride, water for injections, hydrochloric acid (for pH adjustment), sodium hydroxide (for pH adjustment).

Element: What Alpivab looks like and contents of the pack
Text: What Alpivab looks like and contents of the pack

Element: Alpivab is a clear, colourless, sterile concentrate for solution for infusion. It is provided in a clear glass vial with a coated rubber stopper, aluminium overseal and flip-off cap.
Text: Alpivab is a clear, colourless, sterile concentrate for solution for infusion. It is provided in a clear glass vial with a coated rubber stopper, aluminium overseal and flip-off cap.

Element: Each carton contains 3 vials.
Text: Each carton contains 3 vials.

Text: This leaflet was last revised in {MM/YYYY}.

Element: Detailed information on this medicine is available on the European Medicines Agency web site: http://www.ema.europa.eu.
Text: Detailed information on this medicine is available on the European Medicines Agency web site: http://www.ema.europa.eu.

Element: The following information is intended for healthcare professionals only:
Text: The following information is intended for healthcare professionals only:

Element: Use aseptic technique during the preparation of Alpivab to prevent microbial contamination. There is no preservative or antibacterial agent in the solution. Do not mix or co-infuse Alpivab with other medicines administered into a vein.
Text: Use aseptic technique during the preparation of Alpivab to prevent microbial contamination. There is no preservative or antibacterial agent in the solution. Do not mix or co-infuse Alpivab with other medicines administered into a vein.

Element: Follow the steps below in the provided order to prepare a diluted solution of Alpivab:
Text: Follow the steps below in the provided order to prepare a diluted solution of Alpivab:

Element: 1.Check the seal of each vial. Do not use if the seal opening is broken or missing.
Text: 1.Check the seal of each vial. Do not use if the seal opening is broken or missing.

Element: 2.Inspect the Alpivab concentrate. It must be colourless and without particulate matter.
Text: 2.Inspect the Alpivab concentrate. It must be colourless and without particulate matter.

Element: 3.If a patient receives 600 mg peramivir the required volume of Alpivab concentrate is 60 mL (3 vials of 20 mL each). In the case of a 300 mg peramivir dose, 30 mL (1½ vials) of Alpivab concentrate is needed and for a 200 mg dose, only 20 mL (1 vial). Fractions of a vial may be needed for appropriate dose adjustments in children with a bodyweight of less than 50 kg.
Text: 3.If a patient receives 600 mg peramivir the required volume of Alpivab concentrate is 60 mL (3 vials of 20 mL each). In the case of a 300 mg peramivir dose, 30 mL (1½ vials) of Alpivab concentrate is needed and for a 200 mg dose, only 20 mL (1 vial). Fractions of a vial may be needed for appropriate dose adjustments in children with a bodyweight of less than 50 kg.

Element: 4.Add the measured volume of Alpivab concentrate into the infusion container.
Text: 4.Add the measured volume of Alpivab concentrate into the infusion container.

Element: 5.Dilute the required dose of Alpivab concentrate in sodium chloride 9 mg/mL (0.9 %) or 4.5 mg/mL (0.45 %) solution for infusion, 5 % dextrose or Ringer lactate solution to a volume of 100 mL.
Text: 5.Dilute the required dose of Alpivab concentrate in sodium chloride 9 mg/mL (0.9 %) or 4.5 mg/mL (0.45 %) solution for infusion, 5 % dextrose or Ringer lactate solution to a volume of 100 mL.

Element: 6.Administer the diluted solution via intravenous infusion over 15 to 30 minutes.
Text: 6.Administer the diluted solution via intravenous infusion over 15 to 30 minutes.

Element: 7.Once a diluted Alpivab solution has been prepared, administer immediately or store in a refrigerator (2 °C to 8 °C) for up to 24 hours. If refrigerated, allow the diluted Alpivab solution to reach room temperature, then administer immediately.
Text: 7.Once a diluted Alpivab solution has been prepared, administer immediately or store in a refrigerator (2 °C to 8 °C) for up to 24 hours. If refrigerated, allow the diluted Alpivab solution to reach room temperature, then administer immediately.

Element: 8.Discard any unused diluted solution of Alpivab after 24 hours.
Text: 8.Discard any unused diluted solution of Alpivab after 24 hours.

Element: No special requirements for disposal.
Text: No special requirements for disposal.

Element: Any unused medicinal product or waste material should be disposed of in accordance with local requirements.
Text: Any unused medicinal product or waste material should be disposed of in accordance with local requirements.
